--- title: "Space" date: "2023-11-06" date_end: "2023-11-10" --- ## Readings It looks like this is a lot of reading, but lots of these are short videos or tweets or interactive websites, so don't worry! - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 10 in *The Truthful Art* [@Cairo:2016] - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 7](http://socviz.co/maps.html) in *Data Visualization* [@Healy:2018] - Look through these examples of using the {sf} package: - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Andrew Heiss, ["How to make fancy road trip maps with R and OpenStreetMap"](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2023/06/01/geocoding-routing-openstreetmap-r/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Andrew Heiss, ["Road trip analysis! How to use and play with Google Location History in R"](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2023/07/03/using-google-location-history-with-r-roadtrip/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Andrew Heiss, ["Making Middle Earth maps with R"](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2023/04/26/middle-earth-mapping-sf-r-gis/) - {{< fa brands youtube >}} [Why all world maps are wrong](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIID5FDi2JQ) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [The True Size Of…](https://thetruesize.com) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Projection comparison](https://observablehq.com/@d3/projection-comparison) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Map projections](https://xkcd.com/977/) (try comparing Robinson with Mercator to see how badly Mercator exaggerates the northern hemisphere) - {{< fa brands youtube >}} [Gall-Peters Projection](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vVX-PrBRtTY) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["When Maps Lie"](https://www.citylab.com/design/2015/06/when-maps-lie/396761/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Animated Mercator distortion](https://twitter.com/neilrkaye/status/1050740679008296967) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["These Twisted Maps Prove That America Isn't a Red Country"](https://newrepublic.com/article/115550/cartograms-are-important-inforgraphic-tool) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["The next great fake news threat? Bot-designed maps"](https://www.fastcompany.com/90230916/the-next-great-fake-news-threat-bot-designed-maps) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["New World Map That Accurately Shows Earth in 2D Created by Scientists"](https://www.newsweek.com/equal-earth-map-continents-accurate-2d-1102404) ### Possible questions to reflect on ::: {.callout-warning} #### This is not a required list! Remember, you don't need to answer all of these—or even any of them! These are just here to help guide your thinking. **Write about whatever you want.** ::: - How can you know if a map projection is truthful or misleading? - What's wrong (or not wrong) with using points on maps? Choropleths? Lines? ## Other resources If you want to understand how the magic `geometry` column actually works, check out [this fantastic post](https://www.jessesadler.com/post/simple-feature-objects/). Check out [this post where someone used {ggplot2} and {sf} to create fancy city map-based art that she printed for a friend](https://www.katiejolly.io/blog/2019-01-21/map-cutouts). You can do similar things after this session! In addition to the example for this session, you can [check out this tutorial on using the {sf} package to create maps](https://r-spatial.org//r/2018/10/25/ggplot2-sf.html). It shows how to include fancy map stuff like a north arrow and scale bar. ## Slides The slides for this week's lesson are available online as an HTML file.
